required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of Daclatasvir (BMS-790052) Plus Pegylated Interferon-Alfa 2a and Ribavirin in Patients Coinfected With Untreated Hepatitis C Virus and HIV Virus
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Open Label Study of Safety and Efficacy With BMS-790052 Plus Peg-Interferon Alfa 2a and Ribavirin in Previously Untreated HCV Patients Coinfected With Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) and Hepatitis C Virus (HCV)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this open label study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of daclatasvir plus pegylated interferon-alfa 2a and ribavirin in untreated hepatitis C virus in patients coinfected with HIV

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response at Follow-up Week 12 (SVR12)
primary_outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as hepatitis C virus (HCV) values lower than the lower limit of quantitation, target detected or target not detected at follow-up Week 12. HCV RNA levels were measured by the Roche COBAS® TaqMan® HCV Test version 2.0 from the central laboratory. HAART=highly active antiretroviral therapy. SVR12 was defined as hepatitis C virus (HCV) values lower than the lower limit of quantitation, target detected or target not detected at follow-up Week 12. HCV RNA levels were measured by the Roche COBAS® TaqMan® HCV Test version 2.0 from the central laboratory. HAART=highly active antiretroviral therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA Levels Lower Than The Lower Limit of Quantitation (LLOQ), Target Detected (TD) or Target Not Detected (TND)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12 and at both Weeks 4 and 12; end of treatment; and follow-up Weeks 12 and 24
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who achieved HCV RNA levels lower than the LLOQ i.e., 25 IU/ml, TD or TND. HCV RNA levels were measured by the Roche COBAS® TaqMan® HCV Test version 2.0 from the central laboratory. HAART=highly active antiretroviral therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA Levels Lower Than the Lower Limit of Quantitation (LLOQ), Target Not Detected (TND)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 and at both Weeks 4 and 12; end of treatment; and follow-up Weeks 12 and 24
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who achieved HCV RNA levels lower than the LLOQ, TND. HCV RNA levels were measured by the Roche COBAS® TaqMan® HCV Test version 2.0 from the central laboratory. HAART=highly active antiretroviral therapy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Received Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy (HAART), Maintained HIV RNA <40 Copies/mL, and Experienced Confirmed HIV RNA ≥400 Copies/mL
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who received HAART, maintained HIV RNA <40 copies/mL, and experienced confirmed HIV RNA ≥ 400 copies/mL were determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response (SVR12) by rs12979860 Single Nucleotide Polymorphism (SNP) in the IL28B Gene
secondary_outcome.description: Percentages calculated as number of responders/number who received treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Died and With Serious Adverse Event (SAEs), Grade 3 to 4 Adverse Events (AEs), and AEs Leading to Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to 7 days post last dose of study treatment (up to Week 48)
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse event was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a pre-existing condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; was life-threating, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required prolonged hospitalization. HAART=highly active antiretroviral therapy.

intervention.description: Tablets; oral; 30, 60, or 90 mg; once daily; up to 24 weeks

Tablets; oral; for patients weighing <75 kg, the total dose is 1000 mg per day (2 200-mg tablets in the morning and 3 200-mg tablets in the evening); for patients weighing >75 kg, the total dose is 1200 mg per day (3 200-mg tablets in morning and 3 200-mg tablets in evening); twice daily with food; 24 or 48 weeks depending on response
Syringe, subcutaneous injection, 180 μg, once weekly, 24 or 48 weeks depending on response

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding BMS clinical trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females, 18 to 70 years of age
- Hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype 1a or 1b
- HCV-treatment naive
- HCV RNA >10,000 IU/mL at screening
- HIV-1 infection (approximately 250 patients receiving highly active antiretroviral therapy [HAART], up to 50 patients not receiving HAART)
- For patients receiving HAART, HIV RNA must be below <40 copies/mL at screening and must be <400 copies/ml for at least 6 months prior to screening
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients receiving HAART who first initiated antiretroviral therapy within the last 6 months of Day 1
- Patients receiving HAART who have changed their antiretroviral regimen due to safety or efficacy associated to HIV treatment within the last 3 months prior to Day 1. However, if changes are required to a patient's HAART regimen to meet the requirements of the protocol, these changes are allowed at the screening visit. The patient should wait a minimum of 1 month prior to Day 1 after a repeat of HIV viral load has been confirmed, <40 copies/ mL
- Use of prohibited HAART regimens within 1 month of Day 1 and throughout the treatment period of the trial (patients receiving HAART who have changed their antiretroviral regimen to initiate any HCV treatment within 6 weeks prior to Day 1)
- Laboratory values:
1. Neutrophil count <1500 cells/μL (<1200 cells/ μL for Blacks)
2. Platelet count <90,000 cells/μL
3. Hemoglobin ≤12 g/dL for females, hemoglobin ≤13 g/dL for males
4. Total bilirubin ≥34 μmol/L (or ≥2 mg/dL) unless a patient has a documented history of Gilbert's disease or antiretroviral regimen contains atazanavir
5. Alanine aminotransferase ≥5*upper limit of normal

facility.name: University Of Miami School Of Medicine
Upper Delaware Valley Infectious Diseases, Pc
Icahn School Of Medicine At Mount Sinai
University Of North Carolina At Chapel Hill
University Of Puerto Rico School Of Medicine

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 84 sites in 13 countries.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 549 participants enrolled, 301 were randomized to receive treatment. Of the 248 participants who were not randomized, 204 no longer met study criteria, and 44 discontinued due to other reasons.

group.title: Highly Active Anti-Retroviral Therapy (HAART):Daclatasvir,30mg
group.description: Participants taking HIV ritonavir-boosted protease inhibitors received daclatasvir tablets, 30 mg, orally once daily; peg-interferon alfa-2a (pegIFNalfa-2a) solution for injection, 180 µg, subcutaneously once weekly; and ribavirin tablets, orally twice daily with a total dose of 1000 mg for participants weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg for those weighing ≥75 kg, for up to 24 weeks. Participants without virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12 continued to receive pegIFNalfa-2a and ribavirin for a total duration of 48 weeks.

group.title: HAART: Daclatasvir, 60 mg
group.description: Participants taking other HAART, including rilpivirine, received daclatasvir tablets, 60 mg, orally once daily; pegIFNalfa-2a solution for injection, 180 µg, subcutaneously once weekly; and ribavirin tablets orally twice daily with a total dose of 1000 mg for participants weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg for those weighing ≥75 kg, for up to 24 weeks. Participants without virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12 continued to receive pegIFNalfa-2a and ribavirin for a total duration of 48 weeks.

group.title: HAART: Daclatasvir, 30 mg + 60 mg
group.description: Participants taking non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors, except rilpivirine, received 2 daclatasvir tablets (1x30 mg and 1x60 mg), orally once daily; pegIFNalfa-2a solution for injection, 180 µg, subcutaneously, once weekly; and ribavirin tablets, orally twice daily for a total dose of 1000 mg for participants weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg for those weighing ≥75 kg, for up to 24 weeks. Participants without virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12 continued to receive pegIFNalfa-2a and ribavirin for a total duration of 48 weeks.

group.title: Non-­HAART Therapy
group.description: Participants not receiving HAART received daclatasvir tablets, 60 mg, orally, once daily; pegIFNalfa-2a solution for injection, 180 µg, subcutaneously, once weekly; and ribavirin tablets, orally, twice daily with a total dose of 1000 mg for participants weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg for those weighing ≥75 kg, for up to 24 weeks. Participants without virologic response at weeks 4 and 12 continued to receive pegIFNalfa-2a and ribavirin for a total duration of 48 weeks.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Patient no Longer Meets Study Criteria

baseline.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study therapy.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

group.title: HAART Therapy: Daclatasvir 30 or 60 or 90 mg
group.description: Participants with prior exposure to HAART therapy, received daclatasvir tablets , either 30, 60 or 90 mg, orally, once daily; pegIFNalfa-2a solution for injection, 180 µg, subcutaneously, once weekly; and ribavirin tablets, orally twice daily for a total dose of 1000 mg for Participants weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg for those weighing ≥75 kg, for up to 24 weeks. measure.description: SVR12 was defined as hepatitis C virus (HCV) values lower than the lower limit of quantitation, target detected or target not detected at follow-up Week 12. HCV RNA levels were measured by the Roche COBAS® TaqMan® HCV Test version 2.0 from the central laboratory. HAART=highly active antiretroviral therapy. SVR12 was defined as hepatitis C virus (HCV) values lower than the lower limit of quantitation, target detected or target not detected at follow-up Week 12. HCV RNA levels were measured by the Roche COBAS® TaqMan® HCV Test version 2.0 from the central laboratory. HAART=highly active antiretroviral therapy.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Achieved Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) RNA Levels Lower Than The Lower Limit of Quantitation (LLOQ), Target Detected (TD) or Target Not Detected (TND)
outcome.description: Participants who achieved HCV RNA levels lower than the LLOQ i.e., 25 IU/ml, TD or TND. HCV RNA levels were measured by the Roche COBAS® TaqMan® HCV Test version 2.0 from the central laboratory. HAART=highly active antiretroviral therapy.
outcome.time_frame: Week 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12 and at both Weeks 4 and 12; end of treatment; and follow-up Weeks 12 and 24
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in all participants who received at least 1 dose of study therapy. On-treatment virologic response rates were not significantly different from one another among 30 mg, 60 mg, and 90 mg groups in the HAART cohort, thus these groups were combined as per pre-specified analysis plan.

outcome.population: The analysis was performed in all participants who received at least 1 dose of study therapy. Here 'n' signifies number of participants evaluable at the specified time-point.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Died and With Serious Adverse Event (SAEs), Grade 3 to 4 Adverse Events (AEs), and AEs Leading to Discontinuation
outcome.description: Adverse event was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a pre-existing condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; was life-threating, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required prolonged hospitalization. HAART=highly active antiretroviral therapy.
outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 to 7 days post last dose of study treatment (up to Week 48)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

Participants without virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12 continued to receive pegIFNalfa-2a and ribavirin for a total duration of 48 weeks.

group.title: HAART Therapy: Daclatasvir 30 or 60 or 90 mg
group.description: Participants with prior exposure to HAART therapy, received daclatasvir tablets , either 30, 60 or 90 mg, orally, once daily; pegIFNalfa-2a solution for injection, 180 µg, subcutaneously, once weekly; and ribavirin tablets, orally twice daily for a total dose of 1000 mg for Participants weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg for those weighing ≥75 kg, for up to 24 weeks. Participants without virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12 continued to receive pegIFNalfa-2a and ribavirin for a total duration of 48 weeks.

group.title: Non-HAART Therapy: Daclatasvir, 60 mg
group.description: Participants not receiving HAART received daclatasvir tablets, 60 mg, orally, once daily; pegIFNalfa-2a solution for injection, 180 µg, subcutaneously, once weekly; and ribavirin tablets, orally, twice daily with a total dose of 1000 mg for participants weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg for those weighing ≥75 kg, for up to 24 weeks. Participants without virologic response at weeks 4 and 12 continued to receive pegIFNalfa-2a and ribavirin for a total duration of 48 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Died and With Serious Adverse Event (SAEs), Grade 3 to 4 Adverse Events (AEs), and AEs Leading to Discontinuation
measure.description: Adverse event was defined as any new unfavorable symptom, sign, or disease or worsening of a pre-existing condition that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with treatment. SAE was defined as a medical event that at any dose resulted in death, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or drug dependency/abuse; was life-threating, an important medical event, or a congenital anomaly/birth defect; or required prolonged hospitalization. HAART=highly active antiretroviral therapy.
measure.population: The analysis was performed in all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

reported_events.time_frame: From Day 1 to 7 days post last dose of study treatment (up to Week 48)

group.title: Highly Active Anti-Retroviral Therapy (HAART):Daclatasvir,30mg
group.description: Participants taking HIV ritonavir-boosted protease inhibitors received daclatasvir tablets, 30 mg, orally once daily; peg-interferon alfa-2a (pegIFNalfa-2a) solution for injection, 180 µg, subcutaneously once weekly; and ribavirin tablets, orally twice daily with a total dose of 1000 mg for participants weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg for those weighing ≥75 kg, for up to 24 weeks. Participants without virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12 continued to receive pegIFNalfa-2a and ribavirin for a total duration of 48 weeks.

group.title: HAART Therapy: Daclatasvir, 60 mg
group.description: Participants taking other HAART, including rilpivirine, received daclatasvir tablets, 60 mg, orally once daily; pegIFNalfa-2a solution for injection, 180 µg, subcutaneously once weekly; and ribavirin tablets orally twice daily with a total dose of 1000 mg for participants weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg for those weighing ≥75 kg, for up to 24 weeks. Participants without virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12 continued to receive pegIFNalfa-2a and ribavirin for a total duration of 48 weeks.

group.title: HAART: Daclatasvir, 30 mg + 60 mg
group.description: Participants taking non-nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors, except rilpivirine, received 2 daclatasvir tablets (1x30 mg and 1x60 mg), orally once daily; pegIFNalfa-2a solution for injection, 180 µg, subcutaneously, once weekly; and ribavirin tablets, orally twice daily for a total dose of 1000 mg for participants weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg for those weighing ≥75 kg, for up to 24 weeks. Participants without virologic response at Weeks 4 and 12 continued to receive pegIFNalfa-2a and ribavirin for a total duration of 48 weeks.

group.title: Non-HAART Therapy: Daclatasvir, 60 mg
group.description: Participants not receiving HAART received daclatasvir tablets, 60 mg, orally, once daily; pegIFNalfa-2a solution for injection, 180 µg, subcutaneously, once weekly; and ribavirin tablets, orally, twice daily with a total dose of 1000 mg for participants weighing <75 kg and 1200 mg for those weighing ≥75 kg, for up to 24 weeks. Participants without virologic response at weeks 4 and 12 continued to receive pegIFNalfa-2a and ribavirin for a total duration of 48 weeks.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
